sense.name: a dealer of wares or goods
sense.commentary: TRADER[+/-individual][+wares] Note: can be either an entity (e.g., a nation) or an individual
sense.examples: There were many fur traders in North America during the 18th century. Mary is a trader who specializes in Irish ceramics. The government suspects that nation has become a trader of nuclear weapons.

sense.name: person who buys and sells financial products, e.g. stocks
sense.commentary: TRADER[+individual][+financial_products] Note: always an individual or group of them, not an entity.
sense.examples: Several traders at the stock exchange were indicted last week. John worked as a bond trader for three years on Wall Street. Many traders have long positions on oil futures.

sense.name: a ship
sense.examples: The Coast Guard inspected some small traders off the Florida coast.
